review: Dr. Biehl saved my dad's life! Four years ago my dad was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer. It was a terrible cancer to have because most patients had no symptoms until it is too late. We search high and low for a surgeon who would take my dad's case. After much effort, no one thought that was a possible surgery except Dr. Biehl. I still remember the surgery day. It was intense and emotional. But my dad made it! It has been four years now and my dad is doing well. I always want to thank him. Thank you Dr. Biehl for doing what you do. May God bless you!
He saved my life with a very complicated whipple surgery. The best pancreatic surgeon in Seattle! He has tremendous knowledge, skill, experience, and the sweetest disposition ever.

Kind, thorough, honest, down-to-earth, open, prompt. I received great care from him and his staff for the gall bladder removal and hernia repair. I felt like I was in good hands in his office and the operating room. I highly recommend him if you need surgery in one of his specialties.
The most amazingly skilled surgeon ever! If you need pancreatic surgery, he's one of the best in the nation. So kind and compassionate, always smiles, and is a good listener. He saved my life.

I am shopping for a doctor who offers liposuction. Dr. Precht's claims about her credentials are misleading -- she is board certified as a general surgeon, not a cosmetic or plastic surgeon. The American Academy of Cosmetic Surgery is only a membership group open to all physicians, not a certification board. Nor does it offer surgical fellowships, like Dr. Precht claims.

I had liposuction done on my abdomen & hips 5 weeks ago. I did A LOT of research before I chose Dr. Precht. I am so incredibly happy I chose her! The day of the procedure went very smoothly, and that afternoon I just went home and slept. The next day, I was back to my usual self, although I was a little sore. But already my results are beyond my expectations!! I am finally comfortable with my body, and I recently put on a bikini and felt great, something I hadn't done in YEARS!!! Her staff is super nice and professional, and made me feel so welcome every time I had an appointment. I am so happy with my results and highly recommend her!
Amazing surgeon! Love my results from Vaser Lipo!! Only wish I did it sooner. Thank you Premier Cosmetic Surgery & Dr. Precht!!
Amazing surgeon!! So happy I chose her! Couldn't be happier with my results!

Dr Precht and her staff have been over the top helpful and friendly through out the entire process of my Tummy Tuck. Even to the point of having Dr Precht's cel phone # after surgery to call anytime day or night 24-7 with any questions or concerns I might have. I have never heard of a doctor doing that before! Also the costs were exactly what were estimated. After researching, Dr Precht was far above the rest on the list for me and I am exceedingly happy I chose her. She is very easy to talk to. Also, her staff is super friendly. The whole experience was a happy one.

I was really pleased with my recent visit to Proliance. The customer service is top notch, professional and friendly. I would like to call out Dr. Lohse for his extra care. I came in with Mallet's finger, which is relatively common for somebody in his field, but he really took the time to explain it to me and what my options were, including the pros and cons. Highly recommended from expertise to bedside manner, thank you!
Very good experience. Explained my problem. Answered all my questions. Would return
Dr. Wechter is the best! I would have trusted no one else with my somewhat rare diagnosis and treatment. I felt truly listened to and looked after. What a kind and wonderful Doctor!
Dr. Wechter is a kind, compassionate physician and surgeon. She explains things well and listens to your concerns. She allows you to be part of the decision making process. 5 stars!!
I love Dr. Wechter. She is a wonderful woman and surgeon. She truly cares about her patients.
Dr Youssef is the best - skilled surgeon, kind natured, friendly and helpful. He assured us during a scary event and took great care of my daughter.
Nothing but the best! Thanks doc for your outstanding care!
A caring physician with a warm and gentle bedside manner.

Kudos to Dr. Hart for taking me on as a patient-after being misdiagnosed at another hospital, Dr. Hart walked me through the procedure during our consult, saw me before the surgery, and checked on me in recovery. He is so knowledgeable,calm, cool and collected with wonderful bedside manner. I would highly recommend him!

Dr. Hart is helpful, knowlegable, and VERY nice! He was comforting and informative. He knew what was wrong and how to fix it. He reassured me and my family on the day of surgery. He actually went out to talk to my family after the surgery (instead of calling or sending a nurse down to talk to them). I was in the hospital for 7 days and he came in EVERY DAY (and sometimes twice a day) to check up on me and see how I was doing. His office staff are helpful and didn't make you feel like just a number. I feel like I am important when I walk in the office and that my concerns and needs are important. In addition, he was able to fit me in for surgery right away. I didn't want to wait weeks or months for a surgeon to decide they can finally do my surgery. Dr. Hart is a wonderful, skilled, and compassionate surgeon. I feel so lucky to have had him as part of my team.

Dr Hart was awesome. I would definitely have him as my surgeon again. He came to see me before the surgery and reassure me that everything would be okay. My problem was worse than originally thought so what was supposed to be a day surgery and ended up with me having to stay in the hospital over the weekend. While all the residents took good care of me, he came in over the weekend to see how I was doing. Great guy, I would love to have him as my dr again (although that would mean I need surgery and that's bad!) :)
very helpful and cheerfulmmade me felt less painful
awesome ! he surprised me with his good skills and knowledge.
very friendly and professional, always had a smile on his face which made me felt a lot easier and forgotten about my pain.
This guy always left me feeling uneasy but I went ahead with the surgery because of his reputation.

He heals worst cases others avoid.
Frankly, most surgeons can't do the complicated surgeries so they don't take the patient.
If you take highly impaired people the risk factors are high.
The worst cases come through the door 'a mess'.
Thank god he did my surgery because an 'average' ortho would have butchered me.
I know this because I've worked inside healthcare (Northwestern, Chicago, Mass General, Boston) all of my adult life, and therefore, I know how to pick a "winner" vs. "average" surgeon.
Most people pick a surgeon because they 'like' them or 'their friends' told them or looking at sites like this. Go Deeper. Study Up.
Training + Experience + level of disability addressed successfully with ALL the facts on board will lead you to Dr. Chapman.
I spent a year researching before I approached him. I am qualified to offer this advice.

Google his name before having him work on you or someone you love. He is being sued for using non FDA products in surgeries where people died. He knew about it & he did it any way. He should be in jail. Find another doctor!

Do your research on this man. He illegally conducted human experiments during spinal surgeries and killed multiple people. All of this info is readily available from various news sources including Seattle times and King 5 news. AVOID THIS DOCTOR AT ALL COSTS
Dr Chapman is amazing. I have had two fusions from him at the university of Washington and met people who came to him from all over the world the have their surgeries.
terrible doctor who screwed up me forever, including shattering my pelvis-may karma do to him as he has done to me
excellent physician , very knowledgable, excellent personality

We are very fortunate for my wife to have been referred to Dr. Jens Chapman. He is an expert in orthopedic and neurology surgery including laminoplasty of the cervical spine; an operation our local orthopedic surgeon would not attempt. He is an outstanding surgeon, was very polite and professional. He took the time to explain in detail the pros and cons of the surgery answering all our questions including several options. He performed the laminoplasty at HMC in early May of 2014 with no complications.

this is a bad doctor - he lies, is rude, and arrogant. thank God for Dr. Wagner after many years of needless surgeries not even done correctly by jens crapman, I will never be right but Wagner at least corrected all of crapman's mistakes (psoas muscle shattered my pelvis, punctured lung) and the pain has lessened-but it will always be there. he also gave me drugs he wasn't to do- read the article written last year by fortune magazine call "Bad To The Bone" will show you the kind of doctor he is-more like a Nazi doctor then a human being. my name is Lora Meade and I live in moses lake and I stand 100% behind what I have said. letting this man operate on me was the worst thing that ever happened to me and my biggest regret in life. those that say he is good also "loved the emperor's new clothes" be careful this man can destroy your life!

Dr. Chapman is very detail oriented. He explains the problem and the possible treatments, so you have choices. He talks with you and not at you. He willingly provides you with additional information and sources that are germane to your particular circumstance. His staff is very helpful in dealing with your insurance company.
Doctor Corman is top cabin. Highly recommended. Both technically and interpersonally skillful.

This man is a wonderful person. He takes the great care of his patients. He listens to their concerns and includes them in his treatment plan. He doesn't talk down to you. I hate waiting in offices and this man is always on time. This is someone I would recommend to anyone. Exceptional doctor!
great staff great doctor very efficient office but still warm and caring

Dr. Pritchett is amazing. His office staff especially Joannie makes each visit better than imagined. I've had other urologist, but this guy knows how to make things that invasive, seem non-invasive. Highly Recommend!!!
A great doctor, who genuinely cared about my wife and her cancer treatment. Took the time to make sure we understood the choices and helped us pick a plan and professionals to help us through.
I'm glad Dr. Buchanan is my breast care specialist. Very thankful to have her.
Amazing surgeon! She listened to my concerns and took the time to answer my questions. Her staff and nurse was awesome as well!
Excellent surgeon--thoughtful and great bedside manner.
Dr. Hunter is the best. I had gastric bypass surgery on 3/27/13 performed by Dr. Hunter. I had no pain after surgery. He is a very caring surgeon. He is always available. I highly recommend him!

Dr. Jeffrey Hunter is the best surgeon I have ever been too. I had no pain after my groin surgery. He definetely is the best surgeon of all listed Washington surgeons. He explained the whole procedure before the surgery. I received top service from him and his office staff. I read all of his reviews, and found him to be tops in his field. Thank you Dr. Hunter for making this experience as pleasurable as possible. May God Bless You, and Your Staff. Thank you again. John H. Kohlenberg.

An absolute dream Dr. She and her staff are the most understanding, efficient, skilled medical staff you would want to see. I had complications after my breast cancer surgery due to the radiation and I was cared for like I was family. Love her!

Dr. Calhoun is an amazing person with amazing staff. She always is on time and once when she wasn't, her nurse came in and said that she was running about 10 minutes behind. She comes highly recommended by other staff and has excellent bedside manner. Dr. Calhoun as well as her nurse were extremely attentive and took me seriously when I thought I had symptoms of something serious. Her nurse called me right back, paged the Dr. and got me scheduled immediately to see the Dr. Dr. Calhoun also said to never feel embarrassed of any symptoms and to always check them out as it could be something - it was great to hear that from an extremely busy surgeon.
I loved this guy, is very knowledgeable and was able to figure out my condition quickly. How would you like to have the same doctor as Ken Griffey Jr.?
Always friendly and very honest. Doesn't over-prescribe. Delegates and refers when needed.

The first appointment that I had with Dr. White started off like most general physicals; then, when we were complete with that he sat down and wanted to have me give him a complete overview of my life in terms of my opinions of my health, aches and pains, and any other genreal concerns. I walked out of the office stunned that a doctor would spend that much time trying to get to know me, as a person. Even though I have moved out of state, I will still use Dr. White as my doctor. He even ansears his e-mails about any concerns I might have. Finally, I raved so much about Dr. White that now my wife is seeing him and has had the same experiance. Great guy!!!!!
Dr. White is smart and personable. He listens well and knows a lot. I don't think anything I say could surprise him.

Dr Heinberg performed hernia surgery on me. Aside from a successful outcome, what I liked was
1. Dr Heinberg has a meaningful amount of experience performing hernia surgery (> 200 surgeries). That's one of the most important criteria to think about in choosing a surgeon.
2. He made a good effort to be responsive and answer my questions. In person and over email.
3. His attitude. I've spoken to at least 8 surgeons about surgery - both for me and as a caretaker for someone else. He's one of the good ones. He cares and has empathy for his patients. And I saw this more than once during the process of my surgery. After researching what could go wrong, I was deeply scared of surgery and he helped me get confident about my decision to have the surgery. And unlike with some other surgeons, I always felt respected - even if my questions were "silly".
Experienced. Responsive. Great attitude.

Dr. Heinberg's office rescheduled my appointment to a different day and then, on the day of, called to see if I could come early, essentially right away. Otherwise, my appointment was going to be bumped to yet another day, so I left work right then and went straight to his office. I then waited in the lobby for 45 minutes; in the exam room, it was 30 minutes before I saw him, and at one point he left the room for a full 15 minutes. He'd come to this appointment straight from surgery and was clearly on an adrenaline high and completely unable to focus. He didn't know why I was there, had consulted the wrong records and didn't know how to bring up the right ones, and he repeatedly cut me off/talked over me as I tried to fill him in on a pretty simple to understand situation. We settled on a particular imaging test, but then when I went to that appointment, they had different instructions from him than what we'd discussed — so that was wasted time all around and, as far as I'm concerned, extra radiation I did not need. Afterward, there was zero follow-up to discuss the results. Would I ever take this doctor's advice or let someone who performed this way during a simple consultation operate on me? Not on my life.

Dr.Heinberg was caring , professional and knowledgeable. He took time to explain my condition as well as all my options for treatment and he welcomed the input of my family and followed me throughout my process. The staff is Excellent and if I needed someone for treatment in the future I would consider foremost. Thank you Sir!

My experience with this doctor was NOT favorable.
He couldn't be bothered to return two phone calls which I left asking two questions: was my tumor
operable and if so, when could he do it. Didn't receive any return call in reply to the questions.
He had sent me to a plastic surgeon regarding a wound left by another tumor and that doctor said
he could do nothing until the new tumor was dealt with. My niece with 30 years nursing experience
was with me at that appointment and heard the plastic surgeon discussing things with Dr. Heinberg
on the phone - she also wondered why the waste of time for an appointment when Dr. Heinberg
should have known there was nothing the plastic surgeon could do until the 2nd tumor was removed.
Bottom-line - the actions of Dr. Heinberg were NOT professional!
caring, good bedside manners, was able to get test done same day, very prompt and explainend symptoms & gave opinion of treatment
Best Doctor ever Very Knowledgable,Kind,sympathetic and efficient!!

I feel that This professional person is a very competant Surgion with all the quals that allows myself to feel that my care is in good hands. I had a very unfortunate thing happen 3 years ago while visiting a local hospital in Richland, Wa. I am a Crohns disease patient with multible surgerys in the past. When complaining to the er room about an infusion reation (symptoms that always generaly occur shortly after my remicade treatment). I was misdiagnosed with a perferated bowel which required immediated attention. The medical staff failed to contact my G.I. Dr. and proceeded to remove all but 8" of my colon. My case file and records were sent to S.California for further review. With a cast of many top notch individuals in their field, (Colo-rectal surgions, Professors of Gastointestinal Medicine, as well as others in the field), out-come was NEGLIGENCE! "Patients standard level of care violated" Choice to not involve Dr. Chang was made inorder not to interrupt or even terminate op.

When I had complications after bariatric surgery Dr. Chang was rude, insinuating that the complications were all my fault. Kept saying that she didn't do anything wrong and that "some people were just not made for this surgery." I was in a lot of pain, scared, and hurting, and she made me feel embarrassed and inconsequential. No compassion and her bedside manner was dreadful. Not a very nice person.
Have never left comment before. If you have serious sinus issues, this is not the dr. You want to see. Dr. Calvin knapp is sn ent Dr. That csn help

I was worried about my hearing after having some pain and irritation in my ears, as I live in the flight path near the airport. I also played loud music with my roommates one night and had my right ear pointed directly at the speaker. I decided to see James Rockwell to make sure everything was cool. I found him to be extremely professional, but also personable, sensitive, understanding and caring. What really impressed me about him is that even though in retrospect it was pretty obvious that I was overreacting to my ear problems (turns out I have very good hearing and no other problems), he was extremely gentle about pointing out that he expects me to explore all possible avenues of reassurance before using a doctor for that purpose. Which I agree with completely. Definitely one of the better doctors I've ever gotten help from.
The old office lady is extremely unprofessional! This clinic also has no respect for patients!

I had a deviated septum. Dr Rockwell performed surgery on me, and I was very impressed. He knew exactly what was wrong with me, and knew how to fix it. He took time to explain everything to me in a satisfactory way. He answered all my questions very knowledgeably. It was nice to finally have a doctor listen to me and not act like I didn't know what was going on with my own body.
I've been seeing Dr Rockwell for 10 years and his father before that since the fifties and I'm still kickin.
I was very impressed with Dr. Rockwell's care.

I had a "UPPP" (soft palate resection, tonsil removal, nose job) surgical procedure performed on me by Dr. Rockwell. He promised me that it would be 80% or better chance of complete success. I was to find out later from support staff, (those that treated the fallout from his practice) that he had about one out of eight success rate. That sounds more credible every time over the years since having professionals look at my throat & nose. I was surgery #3 of 5 surgeries he performed that morning. I wonder what happened to patients #4 and #5. I hope they are still alive. Sterile surgical procedures were breached while under Rockwell's care and I lost a month's income, time with my family--recovering in the hospital and elsewhere. More sorrowful was the follow-up sleep study done a year later. Dr. Rockwell's procedure was determined to be not only a failure, but since the surgery, it was concluded that I would spend the rest of my life dependent upon a machine to make me breathe.
This doctor gave me wrong diabetes medication and that affect me over 10 years. The NYS Health Department investigation on Dr. Felix Chu.

I was refereed to Dr Felix Chu by my primary care physician in 2012. The care I received from Dr. Chu was very disappointing. I was experiencing swallowing difficulties, and particles of food were getting stuck in the back of my throat when I ate. This problem frequently developed into ear infections. Dr. Chu ordered a swallow study and an MRI . The swallow study was to study what happens when I eat different types of food. Well after waiting for the proper authorizations the staff insisted that Dr. Chu specifically ordered a liquid only swallow study. Apparently the swallow study that involves consuming small portions of food involved the speech department. I tried to explain to the staff ( actually pleaded). that Dr. Chu wanted for me to have the swallow study that involved food, howeever the doctor's orders were written only for liquids. I unnecessarily paid for two very expensive tests, not to mention subjecting my body to chemicals that were needed to perform those tests. At the follow up appointment Dr. Chu shared that there were no signs of problems. I left extremely frustrated with Dr. Chu and his staff. Exactly two years later I made another appointment to discuss that my swallow problems still existed and was becoming increasingly more painful. Dr. Chu asked about the different type of foods that get lodged in the back of my throat once again.. He also was surprised that I did not have the proper swallow study. He recommended that we start all over again since it had been two years since the other MRI and swallow study. Dr. Chu's office staff told me to expect a call shortly from the department that would perform the tests. I waited a few weeks, and called his office again about my long over due swallow study. I have a fairly complicated medical history and try to stay within the network. today I am looking for a new doctor who will hopefully order the correct tests, amd actually listen to their patients concerns. I have seen a few doctors in my life, and Dr. Chu made me feel that he just did not truly listen. His office staff however deserves the award for most incompetent staff .

Did not coordinate care with my other attending physicians. Ignored I was on Warfarin but he did not moderate or suspend usage before operation that resulted in higher level of blood and slower healing. Seemed disinterested. Went out of country following surgery and had to deal with office staff when complications resulted from medication allergy. Rather than work harder to satisfy my displeasure with his service, he seemed to prefer me to just walk away from his practice in need of another follow-up surgery for the same condition that he failed to resolve.

Dr. Chu's immediate diagnosis and rapid response to my dad’s stage IIII throat & neck cancer along with his excellent team of colleagues saved my dads life 10 years ago this June. I will never forget his genuine care and concern the day of biopsy and for radical surgery following his cancer treatment for my dad and our family. The compassion showed could not have been impersonated. Forever grateful…
Sinus Surgery. Excellent diagnosis and result. Solved breathing, runny nose and snoring problems. Do not, however, expect a return call. Apparently, he is too busy to do so.
He's my angel!! Had complications due to another doctor's mistake and he took care of me. Made me feel safe and in good hands. The best of care and excellent bed side manners..

Dr. Chu did endoscopic sinus, septoplasty, and tonsilectomy in one shot for me. Best decision I ever made and should have done it years earlier. 5 years later, no ill effects and all problems solved. Top notch specialist.
This doctor actually cares about you personally! He is very knowledgeable and precise.

Otolaryngology - Head and Neck Surgery Nice, friendly, knowledgeable. Did an excellent job on my sinus surgery. Only bad thing is he doesn't spend much time with each patient. But that is because he is in such demand for being an excellent surgeon.
Unhappy patient. I would not recommend to anyone. Wrong treatment, bad bed manner. He was not even there when I woke up and he did not take any actions when complications arised.
I love Dr Mathes. Friendly, caring, professional, knowledgable. I would highly recommend to family and friends.

Absolutely adore Dr. Mathes! I am a breast cancer survivor,I had gone through chemo and radio therapy for nearly a year in London,I was later told I had the cancer gene, and was advised to have a double mastectomy.I was later introduced to dear Dr. Mathes, when I decided to have reconstructive surgery, I had a tummy tuck and he moved it up! this is the best decision I have ever made in my life! He was so attentive, and held my hand through the entire process. I now for the first time since I was 27 years old,I am now 52 years old, feel like a complete woman, thanks to this man and his staff, especially my Jen,what a team they both are.I feel so confident, and enjoy life to the limit. I smile every day,and for the first time EVER will be wearing a bikini in Mexico on vacation. Thank you Dr. Mathes, you are the best, I have and will continue to sing your praises and recommend you to everybody who is considering this intense surgery.Thank you for making me a woman again.YOU ARE THE BEST!
Very disappointed with my surgery with this doctor. He recommended and performed a reconstructive surgery procedure that made my condition even worse than it was originally.

Sr. Goldman is a very good Doctor and very nice person. He removed cancer from my colon three years ago and was always there when I needed him. I don't want to see another one. I hope he is not retiring soon. Highly recommened!

I had surgery with by him and he didnt even come say hi to me or talk to me before the surgery. He gave me instruction after the surgery while i was still coming out the the sedation; but didn't bother to come see me after the surgery. I felt like just another number on his list. His office was painfully slow getting a prescription called in for me. Go somewhere else!

I was dx'd with invasive breast cancer in Nov. 2016 after a tumor was seen in a routine mammogram. At first I was stunned & overwhelmed. After I met Dr Javid & the staff at Seattle Cancer Care Alliance (SCCA), I knew I was in good hands. I knew I wanted a surgeon who specializes in breast surgery, which Dr Javis does (along with endocrine cancers). She has an impressive resume. She has a pleasant manner, explained my medical situation well & my treatment options. As a surgeon, she has a delicate, but decisive touch. I chose to have breast conserving lumpectomy with sentinel node biopsy. I had my surgery in December 2016. I had a 1.7 cm tumor removed. There was no cancer in the nodes. I met the criteria to not require radiation follow-up, but am starting estrogen inhibiting medication (Arimidex). I believe Dr Javid probably saved my life. Not that cosmetics were my main concern, I have just the smallest half-moon scar on my breast....even a movies star would be pleased with this outcome. I have had an easy & rapid recovery. I only needed pain medication for one day post surgery (The incision on the breast never hurt really, but the incisions in the armpit were painful). I am now back doing Pilates three times per week. I would recommend Dr Javid & SCCA to any patient needing care for breast cancer.

I had thyroid cancer surgery a few months back and Sara Javid @ Seattle Cancer Care Alliance was my surgeon. During my surgery a nerve was cut to my vocal cord and now my right side is paralyzed. I'm now forced to deal with voice,breathing,swallowing & chocking issues as well as feeling sick all the time. I wanted to share my experience with everyone.
Excellent surgeon - thorough and highly skilled.

I would highly recommend Dr. Adnan Alseidi. He has a wholistic approach that truly addressed me as a whole person. You can tell that he cares deeply and treats his patients with dignity and respect. I personally feel empowered and vital after spending some time with him. I know he is new to the Seattle area; as a native from Seattle, I am so greatful that he is here. He changed my life for the better and I know he is doing the same for others every single day. -Crystal Newton

Dr. Traverso and his staff saved my mother's life in 2011. She was hospitalized with severe Pancreatitis for over 4 months and when Dr Traverso began to treat her the whole family knew she was going to make it. He not only is an incredible and highly respected physician but he also gave the family hope and peace. He was caring, sweet, reliable and amazing in every way. Although my mother is now gone due to other health reasons because of him we had another two years with her. He will always be in our hearts.
Tedrick is the absolutly best Doctor That I have ever had in my sixty four years
he was a great doctor because he helped me through cancer and really tried his best and did whatever he could

Dr Barr is the best surgeon my wife and I have ever. She is extremely knowledgeable and knows her business. She has a great bedside manner and can explain your condition, treatment and results at the patient's level. We have absolute faith and trust in her. Dr Barr performed surgery on my wife to address her pancreatic cancer (whipper procedure) and saved her life. We cannot speak highly enough of her!

During my visit I felt that I was treated very well.I would absolutely recommend this doctor to my family and friends.I felt this visit was an amazing success!Overall I would rate this visit : outstanding!
Dr Dinges is an excellent doctor.

I went to Dr. Billingham for almost two years...he is honest, funny, and intelligent. He is a masterful surgeon that is renouned internationally, yet he treated me like I was important. And after six months of good intention but lousy treatment by other doctors, I found Dr. B refreshing. I can't even tell you how many times I heard other patients tell me, "Dr. B saved my life!" And it's true. He's the best!

Doctor Billingham is a surgeon and does not do surgery unless he feels he has to save your life. He is very educated and an absolute professional with colon cancer. He works very aggressively with cancer and will not operate unless he has to. highly recommend him for patients with colon cancer.
I am a, patient of Dr, Haskeys from Grays Harbor now in Skagit county, would like to find out where he is now . Best Dr. I've had.

I am a 63 year old male who has interacted with a variety of MDs over time. I found Dr. Billingham extremley professional, caring, prompt, skillful, and conservative in his approach. I would recommend him wholeheartedly.
Dr. Davila Bradley looked me in the eyes, was kind, very honest and helpful. He took a great deal of time with me and did not appear to be hurried at all. Very favorable impression.
Wonderful, very caring doctor! Always in time, listens to what you have to say.

Dr Rowen is absolutely the best, not only does he have the best bedside manner, he is very competent and accomplished in his field, the office staff are wonderful. Anyone who chooses Dr Rowen will not be disappointed. John you rock!

EXCELLENT SURGEON, THIS DOCTOR SAVED MY LIFE WHEN NOBODY ELSE COU;D OR DIDNT WANT TO TOUXH ME CAUSDE I WAS TOO COMPLICATED, ALL THE DOCTORS IN MY AREA GAVE UP ON ME, BUT NOT DR. THIRLBY, HE GAVE ME HOPE AGAIN AND GAVE ME MY QUALITY OF LIFE BACK. THANKYOU DR. THIRLBY, YOU TRULY ARE AN AMAZING DOCTOR SEN T BY GOD TO HELP OTHERS LIVE AGAIN. TOUCH ME I MEAN.
He came into my appointment while he was assisting in surgery. All he wanted to do was get rid of me and go back into the surgery room. Very disappointed. Not going back.

I had a ruptured disc and a herniated disc at C 4, 5 and 6. this Dr. told me I would be fine doing my "little senior activities". I am 63 years old and have been very active. I went to another neurosurgeon and am doing very well post-op. By the way, I am a Master's prepared Registered Nurse. I know when I am not treated well and this was a fine example of that. Very disappointing; a waste of time and money.
He did my brain surgery back in 2011 and thnx to him I am still alive.

Dr Flum is very professional and a great surgeon. He took time to really listen to me and was very knowledgeable about my condition, told me about research that he was also doing to help learn more about my condition. I decided to have the surgery with him and was very pleased with the results. He also has a great nurse. Hopefully, I never need surgery again, but if I do I want him to be my surgeon

I was VERY impressed by Dr Rush. He is profoundly competent. I appreciate his straight forward approach, his honesty and integrity. He is very thorough and caring. He doesn't sugar coat things, but maintains a positive bed side manner. There is a reason this man has a successful career and I am delighted with the results of the surgery he performed. I would trust my own child in his hands, and that says a lot.

I consulted with 2 other surgeons about hernia surgery. Dr. Sinanan was much more thorough in his analysis of my medical needs and took into account my medical history in detailing what my surgical needs are. His exam was much more detailed than the others. I've never felt in better hands. He really is the cream of the crop.
Google Sins of Sinanan to find out what this guy is capable of
Highly recommend! An amazing surgeon who cares!
Very good surgeon. Highly recommended. She was able to see me quickly and scheduled surgery promptly.

Staff don't seem to know what they are doing a lot of the time (have gotten conflicting information) but Dr. Dellinger operated on me and I have no complaints (I am 2.5 years post-surgery). He is professional, maybe a bit brusque but clearly knows what he's doing. My surgery was complicated too; it took 4 hours & I was a high-risk patient. I am happy, would go back to him if I ever needed to and wouldn't hesitate to refer friends/family members.

Dr. McCourtie spent more time with me before and after my surgery than I expected. He consulted with another physician before meeting with me, reviewed my test results with me, spent extra time explaining and reviewing my options, answered all my questions and responded to my comments, and then let me make my own decision comfortably. Never at any time did I feel pressured to do one procedure over another for the sake of his pocketbook. I feel the good outcome of the surgery was a result of his knowledge of and experience with the subject, sensitivity to my desires to avoid poisonous chemicals, and upbeat, caring treatment of me personally. He had been recommended by a nurse in another department, and I concur in her recommendation of Dr. McCourtie for anyone needing major surgery in the Wenatchee WA area.

My honest experience with this 'doctor' was that he was completely incompetent. In his dealings with me he was consistently arrogant, dismissive and unknowledgeable. He ABSOLUTELY could NOT hear any of my own questions or concerns. Was basically deaf, blind and dumb to me as a sensitive patient interested in the quality of my personal care. Later, upon my discharge, he actually wrote up a report in which he created a completely fictitious scenario -- a TOTAL FABRICATION -- wherein he was some sort of "Master Problem Solver" and I was a problem! A CLEAR attempt to make himself out to be some sort of hero. In all of my years of dealing with medical professionals I have never seen anything like it. This poor fellow is, again, absolutely UNABLE to register patient concerns. I believe that he should NOT be practicing medicine without some sort of major psychotherapeutic intervention. And that he should be watched and rigorously monitored in all of his dealings with patients.
Dr. Neuzil was rude and rushed through the ime visit. To get paid for what he did or I should say did not do should be a crime. If you have to see him for a IME, REFUSE !!!
Dr Johansen is a great surgeon and very knowledgeable, but his staff is terrible.
Cold, calculating, over-confident, calloused and did not treat me as if I was human, but another math problem.

Dr. Ting performed inguinal hernia repair surgery on me in 2002. He didn't tell me about any possible complications beforehand (and Swedish Hospital had me sign something saying I had been so informed), but afterwards my whole groin turned purple and one of my testicles swelled to the size of my fist. Moreover, I was abused by the administrator, the nurse, and the anesthesiologist. But what really bothers me is that after six years of numbness at the site of the operation, it suddenly stopped being numb and started hurting, especially every time I have an orgasm. I notified Dr. Ting immediately by fax, and got no reply. Then I called his office several months later and was told that he wouldn't see me unless I pay cash up front because I no longer have insurance. I complained, and his business manager said she would have him take care of me and she would call me back. She didn't. It is amazing to me that Dr. Ting doesn't even want to learn about problems with his procedure.

Dr. Chung performed a sentinel node biopsy & lumpectomy for breast cancer. Dr. Chung removed two auxiliary nodes as "collateral damage" because she did not know why they were enlarged. Dr. Chung failed to achieve good margins, and a second surgery further mutilated my breast. Dr. Chung had examined me yet failed to notice obvious signs of previous weight loss, and she blamed her surgical failure on my body. As a result of her arrogance and dismissiveness, Dr. Chung was unprepared for my surgery.
please see above ratings to get a better idea

I truly believe he botched my surgery, but I don't have any definitive proof as he can just say I didn't follow his recovery directions, which is true because every time I talked to him, he told me something different. He started my surgery late, he left before I woke up, and nobody even told me what they had done. I had to call and ask the next day. Then in my follow up appointments he changed his story every time about my recovery. He comes off as a nice guy, but the more I dealt with him the less I thought of him. I plan on having his "routine surgery" botch fixed this fall by someone else at a different clinic. I hurt just as much today as I did right after surgery a year ago and he told me you should have no pain after a month. From now on I will insist on more upfront info and get 2nd and 3rd opinions.

After surgery, told me he was "upset" with me as complaining too much and that I would be fine shortly. It's now 7 months later, I've seen 6 other doctors and am having surgery from someone else this Friday. I would definitely not recommend him.

This is, without a doubt, the worst doctor I have ever seen. He was rude, condescending, and a rare example of pure chauvenism. I had a serious medical problem that needed prompt attention, but I started over with another doctor as I did not trust my life in this man's hands. BEWARE.
would recommend to family and friends

Performed unescessary inguinal hernia surgery on me then filled my groin and abdomen with a piece of mesh the size of my hand after showing me a little patch in the consultation then put this piece of polypropylene plastic mesh in me for just a little lipoma which I didn’t need surgery for. Never told me the Mesh was plastic in the consultation. Dr Taagen and Brakstad failed to properly diagnose the necessity of surgery. I had Mesh removal from the toxic plastic and pain a year later which ruined my life. All this for a lipoma and greedy bad guidance.

Dr. Hotaling and his always unpleasant PA Kelley Taylor have wasted two years of my life with constant tests and ill-advised procedures that have cost me hundreds of dollars and my insurance provider thousands of dollars. He and Kelley care little for patient care, do not listen or accurately document feedback and are only looking for patients that they can grossly overcharge continually. During our first meeting he flat out admitted this while explaining how nice the new Day Break Clinic is but that it had to be paid for with increased billable hours. How’s that for quality of care!? I first visited Dr. Hotaling for ED treatment. Wisely, he wanted to rule out any underlying or obvious health conditions that might be the main cause of my issue. Since that meeting I have followed EVERY piece of advice they have recommended. I met with a general practitioner and nothing found during physical. I met with a cardiologist who discovered I had high cholesterol. So far he is the only one who has made an accurate diagnosis and prescribed medications to deal with it. The last 18 months have been a series of countless tests or procedures ordered by Dr. Hotaling and Kelley. I made eleven visits to get over 30 different blood tests done. I have visited their offices six times. I even underwent a horrifically unpleasant experience where he took 12 small samples directly from my Prostate. The results of all of that….nothing…completely cleared. All of these costly tests revealed nothing but elevated testosterone, estrogen and red blood cells. He refused to treat the estrogen problem because I wouldn’t turn all my hormone care over to him so I had to find drugs and treat it myself. He agreed to keep monitoring my blood levels but that was over-ruled by Kelley who said they treated the initial symptoms and they were free from a liability standpoint and wouldn’t be treating me in that area. Just tremendous care for the patient there, done as soon as they aren’t liable. Clearly they are both in medicine for the right reason. During my first visit I was honest with Dr. Hotaling and informed him I self-administered testosterone. I thought honesty was the right course but it was continually used against me from that point on and Kelley was particularly judgmental about it and focused more on that than the patient care I was seeking. He continually threatened severe life consequences as a result of my testosterone use. But, when pressed, he could provide ZERO clinical studies to prove his point. He said it has been “possibly” linked to liver disease and kidney function and possibly to some forms of cancer, but would not provide any data to back this up. I did my own research, he was referencing a different steroid designed for animals that I never used. I went forward with their care for ED which got me unpleasant results. They prescribed close to $800 dollars in oral medications initially which my insurance does not cover and I refused as an option. Clearly he has a great relationship with the drug companies….wonder how many Utah basketball and football and NBA games he was treated to over the last couple years as a result? They also prescribed me Timix which is a straight injection into the area. During the first in-office test I informed Kelley that there was no difference in blood volume to the area. She disagreed and said there was. She ordered a prescription that was vastly under-dosed. I informed her two visits later that I had to greatly exceed the prescribed volume. She ignored the feedback and told me “if it worked once it will work every time.” The prescribed amount was 10 to 15 iu. I was using 90 iu I remember telling Kelley that specifically but she still documented it in the system as me using only 60 iu! Over the last year I’ve suffered through multiple injections each time at the under-dosed amount. Today when I walked in for my one year follow up, Dr. Hotaling and Kelley had a clear agenda they followed. She wasn’t scheduled to be there but showed up. He was unpleasant from the get go. He made a couple rude remarks about my testosterone that was still not backed by any facts. When I told him the amount of Timix I was using he looked shocked as it was up to 170 iu’s in order to work and he accused me of misuse?! I told him I’d documented this many months prior with Kelley but she just stared at her computer screen. He suddenly looked relived as he had his out and he said he was uncomfortable treating me because I had misused the prescription. After the countless misguided tests that produced nothing of value, after close to twenty total visits to his office and the office of his colleagues, eleven visits to the blood clinic, two visits to the hospital….somehow I had not held up my end of the bargain!??? That in a nutshell is the care provided by Dr. Hotaling. I’d avoid them both at all costs. Mr. Jon Huntsman sure nailed it on the head when he said the University Healthcare system in in complete disarray.

Dishonest money grabber who would do unneeded surgery. I would never go to this doctor, nor recommend anyone else should. He suggested I would need surgery in two areas and told me that I should take CoQ10. He said surgery might help, but it wasn't 100%, and even gave me paperwork saying they don't know why the surgery would help. He and his partner in crime, Dr Dorais, pushed us to the most expensive option first and foremost, instead of trying to figure out what is really wrong. I lost a lot of respect for doctors after seeing him, and realize he was looking out for quick money from his patients. Since then, we have found another doctor who said he saw NO need for surgery or even a hint for it. He did a more thorough examination than Dr Hotaling did. I asked him if I should keep taking CoQ10, and he said they're just vitamins and likely wouldn't help our health problem at all. In summary, Hotaling suggested a totally unnecessary surgery for the sake of skimming more money off of us. Do not go to this doctor!

This guy is crazy. I am not sure how he passed medical school, he probably had someone else take the exams for him. He lacks complete subject knowledge. INCOMPETENT, UNSKILLED, RUDE. This guy is crazy! READ THIS: http://www.kirotv.com/news/16186188/deta... what kind of person gets into a fight with street hoodlums? And he is a doctor?? STAY AWAY FROM THIS GUY IF YOU VALUE YOUR LIFE AT ALL!!! I will not recommend his services to anyone. RUN FOR YOUR LIFE, LITERALLY!?

This doctor is more interested in himself than his patients. Let me make it clear, we do not blame him for the cancer, but his narcissism may have cost my partner his life but his unwillingness to do a simple test to rule out any spreading. It may not have shown anything, but you took that away...read on and you will see.
My partner had a missed diagnosis due to lack of attention from Dr. Paul E. Gott. When it was discovered it had moved to a Stage III-IV and had potentially made it into his blood stream. Immediate surgery was performed. After the whole experience, I have a background at Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research and I asked whether he would perform another set of standard scans which he replied "I got it all and there is no need".
Well Dr. Gott, there was a need to rule it out, because now he has metastatic cancer and maybe looking at 3-6 month span. His current dr asked us if the physician performed the very test I asked you about!!!!
If you are assigned Dr. Gott to try and save your life...then just know you are welcome to reach out to me personally and I will share as much detail as legal. Do NOT be fooled by his confidence, I wasn't but had already been through so much I didn't force it. It took another qualified doctor to make me know I knew what I was doing.
You are a horrible doctor, Paul E. Gott!

Dr. Biehl saved my dad's life! Four years ago my dad was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer. It was a terrible cancer to have because most patients had no symptoms until it is too late. We search high and low for a surgeon who would take my dad's case. After much effort, no one thought that was a possible surgery except Dr. Biehl. I still remember the surgery day. It was intense and emotional. But my dad made it! It has been four years now and my dad is doing well. I always want to thank him. Thank you Dr. Biehl for doing what you do. May God bless you!
